intro: Cardamine guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan watercress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. The plant features delicate, trifoliate leaves with a peppery aroma, similar to that of other watercress species. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and arranged in racemes, typical of the Brassicaceae family. Cardamine guatemalensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions of Central America and is sometimes cultivated for its edible leaves.
